meanings.def: in the middle between a larger and smaller size, amount, length, temperature, etc.
examples: There are three sizes—small, medium and large.
a man of medium height/build
a medium steak (= one cooked quite well but not too much)
Cook over a medium heat for 15 minutes.
a medium dry white wine
Choose medium to large tomatoes.
He is a man of medium build, with receding grey hair and a moustache.
Put the eggs in a medium saucepan.
There are hundreds of small and medium enterprises developing software in Brazil.

meanings.def: used to describe what will happen a long, short, etc. time in the future
examples: Such a development seems unlikely, at least in the short term (= it will not happen for quite a long time).
In the longer term, children of depressed mothers are more likely to suffer from childhood depression.
In the long term, our efforts will pay off.

idioms.def: used to describe what will happen a long, short, etc. time in the future
examples: Such a development seems unlikely, at least in the short term (= it will not happen for quite a long time).
In the longer term, children of depressed mothers are more likely to suffer from childhood depression.
In the long term, our efforts will pay off.

meanings.def: a way of communicating information, etc. to people
examples: the medium of radio/television
electronic/audiovisual media
medium of something The internet is the modern medium of communication.
medium for doing something A T-shirt can be an excellent medium for getting your message across.
Radio is an important communication medium in many countries.
The government communicates through the medium of television.
As a political campaigner he quickly learned to exploit the new medium of radio.

meanings.def: something that is used for a particular purpose
examples: medium of something English is the medium of instruction (= the language used to teach other subjects).
medium for doing something Video is a good medium for learning a foreign language.
The first use of tape as a recording medium was in 1956.
She used her novels as a medium for encouraging political debate.
She experimented with the blog as a new medium for exploring issues.

meanings.def: the material used for storing computer files, such as on magnetic tape or discs
examples: Copy files to and from the device as you would with any other storage medium.

meanings.def: the material or the form that an artist, a writer or a musician uses
examples: the medium of paint/poetry/drama
Watercolour is his favourite medium.
Oil paint is her preferred artistic medium.
The gallery has been committed to the photographic medium for 25 years.

meanings.def: a substance that something exists or grows in or that it travels through
examples: The bacteria were growing in a sugar medium.

meanings.def: a person who claims to be able to communicate with the spirits of dead people
something that is in the middle between two choices or two ways of doing something
examples: She tried to strike a happy medium between making the questions too hard and making them too easy.

idioms.def: something that is in the middle between two choices or two ways of doing something
examples: She tried to strike a happy medium between making the questions too hard and making them too easy.
